intro: Pedicularis stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spurred flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often arranged in a whorled pattern along the stem. Pedicularis stenantha thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
